description: Alterations and extensions to the Pond Street entrance area, including: a single storey infill extension and projecting canopy to the main entrance of the building at upper ground floor level; alterations to the lower and upper floor servicing areas comprising removal of internal access ramp and extension of upper ground carparking deck; associated alterations to road layout, pedestrian facilities, lighting and boundary walls.
decision_conditions:
Condition : 1 - The development hereby permitted must be begun not later than the end of three years from the date of this permission.

Reason: In order to comply with the provisions of Section 91 of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 (as amended).

Condition : 2 - All new external work to the front entrance extension and the upper deck extension shall be carried out in materials that resemble, as closely as possible, in colour and texture those of the existing building and structure, unless otherwise specified in the approved application.

Reason: To safeguard the appearance of the premises and the character of the immediate area in accordance with the requirements of policies S1/ S2 and B1 of the London Borough of Camden Replacement Unitary Development Plan 2006.
Condition : 3 - The details of the elevations and facing materials to be used on the proposed entrance canopy shall not be otherwise than as those submitted to and approved by the Council before any work is commenced on the relevant part of the development. The relevant part of the works shall not be carried out otherwise than in accordance with the details thus approved.

Reason: To safeguard the appearance of the premises and the character of the immediate area in accordance with the requirements of policies S1/ S2 and B1 of the London Borough of Camden Replacement Unitary Development Plan 2006.
Condition : 4 - No development shall take place until full details of hard surfacing, soft landscaping, lighting, railings and other furniture, and means of enclosure of all unbuilt open areas (including new boundary walls and railings and any additional associated planting along Pond Street frontage) have been submitted to and approved by the Council.

Reason: To enable the Council to ensure a reasonable standard of visual amenity in the scheme in accordance with the requirements of policies B1 and N8 of the London Borough of Camden Replacement Unitary Development Plan 2006.
Condition : 5 - All hard and soft landscaping works shall be carried out to a reasonable standard in accordance with the approved landscape details by not later than the end of the planting season following completion of the development or any phase of the development, whichever is the sooner. Any trees or areas of planting which, within a period of 5 years from the completion of the development, die, are removed or become seriously damaged or diseased, shall be replaced as soon as is reasonably possible and, in any case, by not later than the end of the following planting season, with others of similar size and species, unless the Council gives written consent to any variation.

Reason: To ensure that the landscaping is carried out within a reasonable period and to maintain a satisfactory standard of visual amenity in the scheme in accordance with the requirements of policies B1 and N8  of the London Borough of Camden Replacement Unitary Development Plan 2006.
Condition : 6 - All trees growing on the adjoining verge of Pond Street, unless shown on the permitted drawings as being removed, shall be retained and protected from damage to the satisfaction of the Council. Details shall be submitted to and approved by the Council before works commence on site to demonstrate how trees to be retained shall be protected during construction work: such details shall follow guidelines and standards set out in BS5837:2005 "Trees in Relation to Construction", and shall show details of the proposed storage of construction materials and accommodation.

Reason: To ensure that the Council may be satisfied that the development will not have an adverse effect on existing trees and in order to maintain the character and amenities of the area in accordance with the requirements of policy N8 of the London Borough of Camden Replacement Unitary Development Plan 2006.
Condition : 7 - No loading or unloading of goods, including fuel, by vehicles arriving at or departing from the proposed upper and lower decks shall be carried out otherwise than within the curtilage of the site.

Reason: To avoid obstruction of the surrounding streets and to safeguard amenities of adjacent premises in accordance with the requirements of policy T16 of the London Borough of Camden Replacement Unitary Development Plan 2006.  
Condition : 8 - Before the use of the new upper and lower deck areas, the access roads, parking bays, pedestrian crossings and designated drop-off area as shown on the drawings hereby approved shall be clearly marked out in thermoplastic paint. Thereafter, the parking bays for disabled vehicles, drop-off short stay vehicles, cycles, motorcycles, ambulances, taxis etc, shall be only occupied by the designated vehicles and cycles in accordance with the plans hereby approved and the markings shall be permanently maintained and retained as such.

Reason: In order to satisfactorily provide for the access and parking of vehicles within the site and in the interests of highways and pedestrian safety in accordance with policy T16 and Appendix 6 of the London Borough of Camden Replacement Unitary Development Plan 2006.
Condition : 9 - Before the development commences, details of the proposed cycle storage areas on the upper ground level deck shall be submitted to and approved by the Council. The approved facility shall thereafter be provided in its entirety prior to use of the approved upper deck parking and thereafter permanently maintained and retained thereafter.

Reason: To ensure the development provides adequate cycle parking facilities in accordance with the requirements of policy T3 of the London Borough of Camden Replacement Unitary Development Plan 2006.
Condition : 10 - Before any works commence on site, a construction management plan shall be submitted to and approved by the Council and the approved method shall be thereafter implemented in its entirety for the duration of the demolition and construction process.

Reason: To avoid obstruction of the surrounding streets and to safeguard amenities of adjacent premises in accordance with the requirements of policy T16 of the London Borough of Camden Replacement Unitary Development Plan 2006.
